org.amv.access.sdk.spi.communication

Interface CommunicationManager

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    BluetoothCommunicationManager

    public interface CommunicationManager
    An interface abstracting the mechanism to start and stop communications with a connected device.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      <any> observeVehicleState()
      An observable emitting incoming vehicle states.
      <any> sendCommand(Command command)
      A mechanism to send commands to a connected device.
      <any> startConnecting(AccessCertificatePair accessCertificatePair)
      This methods starts looking for devices eligible to handle the given access certificate pair.
      <any> terminate()
      Terminate all communication Disconnect from a connected device and do cleanup operations.

    • Method Detail

      • startConnecting

        <any> startConnecting(AccessCertificatePair accessCertificatePair)
        This methods starts looking for devices eligible to handle the given access certificate pair. This methods returns an observable that will complete if looking for devices started successfully.

        If the observable completes, it does NOT mean, that the device has been successfully connected - but rather that the broadcasting started successfully. If you want to be informed when a connection has been established, you have to use a lower level interface like BluetoothCommunicationManager.

        See BluetoothCommunicationManager.observeBroadcastState() or BluetoothCommunicationManager.observeConnectionState() for more fine grained access to the communication state.

        Parameters:
        accessCertificatePair - the access certificate used for establishing a communication channel
        Returns:
        an observable that completes when looking for devices started successfully

      • observeVehicleState

        <any> observeVehicleState()
        An observable emitting incoming vehicle states. This observable is only completes when the communication ends.

        Depending on the concrete implementation, you may have to send a command to request the vehicle state before this observable emits any updates.

        Returns:
        an observable emitting vehicle states

      • sendCommand

        <any> sendCommand(Command command)
        A mechanism to send commands to a connected device. This method returns an observable that completes when the command has been successfully sent. It does NOT indicate, that the command has been understood by the connected device.
        Parameters:
        command - a command that should be sent to the device
        Returns:
        an observable that completes when the command has been successfully sent

      • terminate

        <any> terminate()
        Terminate all communication Disconnect from a connected device and do cleanup operations. This method ends all communication with the connected device and closes all incoming streams. After this method has been invoked it may or may not be possible to call startConnecting(AccessCertificatePair) depending on the implementation.
        Returns:
        an observable that completes when disconnecting has been successful
